description:
confirm-resize failed, after migration. "KeyError: 'old_instance_type_memory_mb'"
Because after migration (Not resize), no "old_*" information exist in sys_meta. (old_* and new_* both exist only after resize operations)

title: confirm-resize failed, after migration. 'KeyError: 'old_instance_type_memory_mb''

comments.content:
confirm-resize failed, after do migration. "KeyError: 'old_instance_type_memory_mb'"
Because after we do migration, no "old_*" information exist in sys_meta.

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yanglyy

comments.content:
Hi Dan,
Could you please take a look at this bug?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yanglyy

comments.content: I believe this has already been fixed. What upstream commit are you working from?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danms

comments.content:
Please take a look at the trace, the issue is in function _downsize_quota_delta(context, instance)

I think this issue is related to this change:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/5908b60b0420f1ad528e56b0c147a330e9a1a5d6
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yanglyy

comments.content: I'm well aware of where the issue is. Please answer my question about the upstream commit you're based on.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danms

comments.content:
It seems as if we based on https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/5908b60b0420f1ad528e56b0c147a330e9a1a5d6

And I find a commit in https://github.com/openstack/nova/commits/milestone-proposed
Is this the fix which you mentioned? Can we cherry pick it directly?


Mar 27, 2013

...
    Always store old instance_type during a migration …
    1fa7879071 Browse code
    Dan Smith authored 6 days ago russellb committed 5 days ago
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yanglyy

comments.content: Yes, that's the fix I'm talking about. I'm going to mark this bug as invalid since it has already been fixed.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danms
